intro: Monopyle stenoloba, commonly known as the narrow-leaved monopyle, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink or white. It thrives in moist, tropical environments and is often found in forest understories. The plant's structure and growth habits make it an important component of its native ecosystems.
